byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Farmville, and Patrick Healy from New York.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and PATRICK HEALY

abstract: Sen Tim Kaine and Gov Mike Pence clash during vice presidential debate, trading attacks and defenses of their running mates Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump; Kaine appears far more aggressive than Pence, who assumes moderate tone that provided counterpoint to Trump's bombast in first presidential debate week before.
lead_paragraph: No. 2 candidates always use their debates to promote and defend the top of the ticket, but Mr. Pence’s role came after a week of outbursts from Donald Trump.
snippet: No. 2 candidates always use their debates to promote and defend the top of the ticket, but Mr. Pence’s role came after a week of outbursts from Donald Trump....

headline.main: Tim Kaine and Mike Pence Clash Sharply Over Their Running Mates
headline.print_headline: Kaine and Pence  Clash on Merits of Their Tickets
